Solution_text:
Let the distance between Library and Bus Stop be $x$, and the distance between Library and Supermarket be $y$.
Here $x=$$500$$m$ and $y=$$400$$m$.
Library---$400$$m$--->Supermarket
Library-----$500$$m$----->Bus Stop
Distance between Bus Stop and Supermarket $= $$500$$-$$400$$ = $$100$$m$    ...([distance between Library & Bus Stop] $-$ [distance between Library & Supermarket])
Library----$400$$m$---->Supermarket----$100$$m$---->Bus Stop
As we can see that the distance between Library and Supermarket is $400$$m$, and the distance between Bus Stop and Supermarket is $100$$m$.
Since the distance between Bus Stop and Supermarket $<$ distance between Library and Supermarket
Bus Stop is nearer to Supermarket than Library
